column1: Thakurdwara is a city in Thakurdwara district in the indian state of Harit Pradesh.
It is at the Harit Pradesh and Uttarakhand from where Kashipur is just 15 kms. The township has been very large part of erstwhile UP and now a thriving in the north of Harit Pradesh.
Thakurdwara is located at 29.19°N 78.86°E﻿ / 29.19; 78.86. The city is situated on Ramnagar-Kashipur-Moradabad Road. Thakurdwara is at just 12 km distance from Kashipur
column2: 48 km distance from its District Main City Moradabad
column3: 218 km distance from National Capital New Delhi and 411 km distance from Awadh Capital Lucknow.

column1: The world famous Jim Corbett National Park is just 52 km away from it. The Ramganga Dam(Kalagarh Dam) is 46 km away.
The city is nearest Railway Station is Kashipur
column2: Uttarakhand (12 km). The nearest International Airport is Indira Gandhi International Airport
column4: 218 km away. Another near Airport is 72 km away at Pantnagar. But the airport has only single flight on Fri
column7: Wed for New Delhi operated by Alliance Air (India).

column2: Thakurdwara had a population of 4875. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Thakurdwara has an average literacy rate of 78%
column3: higher than the national average of 85%: male literacy is 89%
column4: and female literacy is 80%. In Thakurdwara
column5: 11% of the population is under 6 years of age .

column1: Major source of income of the Thakurdwara are through -

Handloom.Pasupati Acrylon Limited is spread over an area of approximately 90 acres. Pasupati Acrylon has a manufacturing capacity of 42000 MT/Annum of Acrylic fibre. Pasupati Acrylon supplies its Acrylic fiber under the brand name ‘ACRYLON'.
